def_cn: 发生冲突;打斗;争论;意见不合
def_en: When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other.

def_cn: (信仰、观点、特性)相互冲突，相互抵触，不相容
def_en: Beliefs, ideas, or qualities that clash with each other are very different from each other and therefore are opposed.

def_cn: (两件事)时间上冲突，撞期
def_en: If one event clashes with another, the two events happen at the same time so that you cannot attend both of them.

def_cn: (色彩或风格)不协调，不搭配
def_en: If one colour or style clashes with another, the colours or styles look ugly together. You can also say that two colours or styles clash .

def_cn: (体育用语中尤用来指热情高涨的比赛双方)交锋，交手，厮杀
def_en: Sports journalists sometimes say that two individuals or teams who compete against each other clash, especially when a lot of feeling is involved.

def_cn: (金属相互碰撞)发出当啷当啷声，发出撞击声
def_en: When metal objects clash, they make a lot of noise by being hit together.
